org.freehep.properties
Interface PropertyConverter<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
BooleanPropertyConverter, FilePropertyConverter, FloatPropertyConverter, IntegerPropertyConverter, ListPropertyConverter, SimpleTypePropertyConverter, StringPropertyConverter, TypedPropertiesConverter, URLPropertyConverter
public interface PropertyConverter<T>

Converter interface defined to convert properties to and from Strings for persistency. You can register converters on typeNames so that they are called when a conversion is needed when you store or load a property of a certain type.

Author:
Mark Donszelmann (Mark.Donszelmann@gmail.com)

Method Summary
 void load(TypedProperties properties, String key, Class<?> type, String value)
          Load key, typeName, value into properties table.
 void store(Properties p, String key, Class<?> type, T value)
          Store property with key, typename and value in p.
 

Method Detail

store

void store(Properties p,
           String key,
           Class<?> type,
           T value)
Store property with key, typename and value in p. You would normally need to convert value to String and maybe do something to the key.

Parameters:
p - java.util.Properties to store property into
key - key to store property under (may be changed)
type - type to store, to be suffixed to value
value - value to store

load

void load(TypedProperties properties,
          String key,
          Class<?> type,
          String value)
Load key, typeName, value into properties table. You would normally convert value to typeName's type and then store it under key. If key has some special meaning you may need to act on it.

Parameters:
properties - table to load property into
key - key under which name to load property
type - type to convert value to
value - value to be loaded into table
